page.title: 17HOUSING SURVEY IN OTTERTON
page.content: The{Clinton Estate}once owned nearly all the houses in Otterton.Now they are selling them off because repairs are costly. They are renovated by private owners who are often retired people. The Council also wants new houses built unused plot around the village. Both processes are happening all the time, especially since about 1970. The most recent little development is Vieux Close, named after Otterton's twinned village in France.These are starter homes costing (Â£25.000) in 1985. Most people there, like their move and have come from local areas. We counted about 40 thatched houses in our block most of them being in the main street. Most of these houses date back to later{Tudor times one of them being dated 1627 on the outside. Research byE.EWINS:A.TINDALE:M.TURBITT
